discussion.content: The third one is NO because the policy hasn't been published at 2pm!

comments.content:
This is correct. 

"Communications are scanned every 24 hours from the time policies are created. For example, if you create an inappropriate content policy at 11:00 AM, the policy gathers communication compliance signals every 24 hours at 11:00 AM daily."

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/communication-compliance-policies?tabs=purview-portal
Third one is Yes. The policy was published at 2:30pm the day before.
it's not 1 August published and 2 August check?

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

You plan to use Microsoft Purview insider risk management.

You need to create an insider risk management policy that will detect data theft from Microsoft SharePoint Online by users that submitted their resignation or are near their employment termination date.

What should you do first?

choices.D: Onboard devices to Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.

discussion.content:
Learn Microsoft Purview 

Set up a connector to import HR data

 Article
 06/17/2024

In this article

 Before you begin
 Step 1: Prepare a CSV file with your HR data
 Step 2: Create an app in Microsoft Entra ID
 Step 3: Create the HR connector

You can set up a data connector to import human resources (HR) data related to events such as a user's resignation or a change in a user's job level. The HR data is used by the insider risk management solution to generate risk indicators that can help you identity possible malicious activity or data theft by users inside your organization.

choices.D: Create a Microsoft Purview communication compliance policy.
choices.B: Onboard the devices to Microsoft Purview.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription.

Users have devices that run Windows 11.

You plan to create a Microsoft Purview insider risk management policy that will detect when a user performs the following actions:

• Deletes files that contain a sensitive information type (SIT) from their device
• Copies files that contain a SIT to a USB drive
• Prints files that contain a SIT

You need to prepare the environment to support the policy.

What should you do?

DRAG DROP
-

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

You plan to update the overall compliance score for the Microsoft 365 environment.

You resolve improvement actions that have a Testing type of Manual and discover that the compliance score fails to update.

You need to ensure that the compliance score for manual improvement actions is updated.

Which three actions should you perform in sequence from Microsoft Purview Compliance Manager? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
The link states the following

Create an assessment: Compliance Manager can recommend assessments that may be most relevant to your organization, or you can create one through a guided process. Visit Create assessments for instructions.

Export improvement actions: You'll export an Excel file containing the action data that you want to update. It may make more sense to start the export from your Assessments page, but you can also export from the Improvement actions page. See the steps outlined below.

Update the improvement action Excel file: Use the instructions on the How to update actions tab of the Excel file to add your information.

Upload the Excel file: Upload your edited Excel file by selecting the Upload actions command on the Assessments or Improvement actions page.

slight difference in the last action wording but seems to check out.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

You create a sensitivity label named Label1 and publish Label1 to all users and groups.

You have the following files on a computer:

• File1.doc
• File2.docx
• File3.xlsx
• File4.txt

You need to identify which files can have Label1 applied.

Which files should you identify?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Dox and txt not supported

Selected Answer: B
Sensitivity labels in Microsoft 365 can be applied to specific file types. Based on the file types you listed, here are the ones that can have Label1 applied:

File2.docx: Microsoft Word document
File3.xlsx: Microsoft Excel spreadsheet
These file types are supported for sensitivity labeling in Microsoft 36512. The other file types, such as .doc and .txt, are not supported for sensitivity labeling.
